title: Backing up e-mails from profile without the settings
creator: cct667
content:
I recently had to transfer the domain associated with my e-mail account. With help from the admins at the domain registry, I altered the account settings in Thunderbird. I got errors which said: "Sending of usernamedid not succeed. Mail server pop.servername responded: invalid format for plain response" The server settings were: Connection security: STARTTLS Authentication method: Normal Password We changed Connection security to SSL/TLS We still got the same response.

I set up Thunderbird on a laptop in the same house, & the account was working fine, both sending and receiving. The only problem was that the e-mails in the inbox were from that point in time and all my old e-mails were not shown.

I have tried backing up the profile on my original computer, uninstaling and re-installing Thunderbird, and I nstill get the same problem. So I am thinking backup the e-mails from the profile, remove everything Thunderbird, (Program + profile), from the original computer, then re-install Thunderbird and setup the account (as I did on the laptop), and then restore the old e-mails if the account is successfully working. The problem that I have with this approach is I do not know how to backup & restore just the e-mails from a profile without all the other settings and configurations associated with that profile.

Any advice with regards to this situation would be gratefully received.

Regards,

Neil Harland
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0

title: Farbdarstellung in Email (Thunderbird) und Webseite (Firefox)
creator: margoteppinger
content:
Guten Tag Gemeinde und Helfer, Ich bin 81 Jahre und habe meinen Laptop entsprechend für meinen Augen eingestellt. Nun stelle ich fest das zwei der folgenden Probleme bestehen: 1. Die farbliche Hervorherbung von Wörtern in Thunderbird funktioniert nicht. D.h. ich kann keine Schriftfarbe ändern.

2. Beim Aufruf von Webseiten (z.Bsp.: https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atomwaffenverbotsvertrag) wird die unterschiedliche Farbmarkierung in der Legende von Grafiken falsch angezeigt. D.h. die Legende ist allles in Schwarz.

Ich habe in der zwischen Zeit folgende Lösungsversuche durchgeführt: 1. Neuinstallation 2. Durchlesen und Suche im Hilfeforum

Ich hoffe Sie können mir Weiterhelfen.

Mit freundlichen Grüßen Margot Eppinger
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:138.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/138.0

title: Thunderbird calendar - Description text put in invite.ics attachment
creator: raimo.vanderlinden
content:
Hi all,

Whenever I send a meeting invite to another person from my calendar and I include any text in the "Description" tab of the invite, that text from the description gets put into an invite.ics file and it sent as an attachment. People using Microsoft Outlook (unfortunately still a lot of people) do not see the description text: People using the "old outlook" cannot seem to open it at all (their outlook tells them "there is no previewer installed for it"), and "new outlook" will open it but only after an extra double-click on the attachment, which is unfortunately too much to ask for certain users.

So, the result is that I cannot invite people to an online meeting because the link to the conferencing tool is hidden in the invite.ics file.

How can I send an invite where the invite text + link are directly visible to Outlook users?

I'm running Thunderbird 128.11.0esr, no active add-ons that seem related to this.

Thanks in advance!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0

title: Lightning & Synology
creator: stu.s
content:
Hi, I have been using Lightning Calendar for as long as I can remember. As part of an ongoing personal data security task, after having my online account hacked, I recently I moved my Calendar Data from the GMX servers to my Synology NAS, Using Caldav I can synchronise data between my Android Phone & my PC, keeping all my data private. It has been working fine for a few months so I move my Wifes calendar data over as well, and that worked great as well. However, I have now come up with a problem, sometimes if I edit an event in on my PC any changes made will not save, however, if I make changes on either my Android Phone or through my browser they do.

So, I think this is possibly an issue with Thunderbird, any suggestions please.

Stu

Note. My address book syncs and can be edited on all devices.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:128.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/128.0

title: Is it possible to block access to my email account by restricting "domains" ?
creator: george.generke.007
content:
Hi,

I'm just a lowly user that happens to use Linux Ubuntu on three computers. I'm having trouble with my email client, Outlook which Thunderbird is handling 'fairly' well - but not perfectly by my standards (or desires).

I may be a small player in the big world of the internet, but I receive around 250 emails per day, and yet roughly half of them are considered "junk" as far as I'm concerned. I know the way to 'train' Thunderbird to recognize junk emails, but that is an ongoing task that consumes too much of my time.

I want to consider the emails I receive from specific websites or 'domains' (sorry, I'm very lax in knowing the proper terminology) as junk to greatly reduce the number of emails I receive from these sites.

As an example: I receive an email from "renewMB8w1@SalonEvSalBoroTo.de" and have no desire to read or respond to it, yet it is in my inbox. When I click on the "junk" icon, it goes directly to my junk folder. But that just "junks" the message sent by "renewMB8w1" while many other similar messages often with the same subject matter come through with the same "SalonEvSalBoroTo.de" domain (again, sorry).

I wish to stop all emails from "SalonEvSalBoroTo.de", as well as others doing the same thing even from accessing my email. And if not, can I at least get Thunderbird to send any email from "SalonEvSalBoroTo.de" (and others doing the same thing) to the junk folder? Or better yet, to the delete folder?

Thanks for reading, and I'm sorry if I'm a very wordy person. I just hope I got my point across.

Best regards,

George Generke
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:138.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/138.0

title: Mozilla Thunderbird V139 Unresponsive
creator: msbaron
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for about 15 years. I just downloaded and installed V139. Thunderbird is now unusable. In the past, performance was great. Downloading email was fast and my filters moved the messages to the appropriate folders with no issues. With the current version 139, downloads take up to 5 minutes for only 4 or 5 messages. The filters run incredibly slowly. I can't scroll either the navigation pane or the preview pane or the messages pane. Version 128.11.0esr runs just fine with no issues on my other system. Both systems run Win10 at the same maintenance level. After all these years, I don't want to change email clients but if this situation doesn't resolve, I'm afraid I will have no choice but to toss Thunderbird in favor of some other solution.

How do I get back to version 128.11.0ser for this system?

title: I have an email account with more emails in the Mail folder than can be accounted for in my archives and the Sent and Inbox folders. I find this confusing.
creator: muh
content:
This is a question about the All Mail folder and the Important folder. I wasn't able to find out in the documentation.

There are more emails in the All Mail and Important folders than can be accounted for in my archives, send and received folders. I counted 545 in my archives. I have 14 in my inbox and 51 in sent mail. I therefore have 610 emails in total. The Trash is empty.

There are 852 emails in the All Mail folder, and 550 in Important. The totals don't match up to anything. I find this confusing.

In the Important folder, only 2 are actually tagged as Important. What are all of the other emails doing there? Can I safely delete them? If any of them are also in my archives, will they also be deleted from there, or are they safe? Does the same go for the All Mail folder?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0

title: Thunderbird Client Interface to Gmail Account
creator: steve.morris
content: I currently use the Daily version of Thunderbird V141.0a1 and I am using it to connect to my Gmail account via Imap. Recently the client has started showing two Junk folders, one I am assuming is for the Thunderbird Junk mail settings, which is being shown as being on the gmail server but the folder doesn't exist when I use the web interface into gmail, the second Junk folder is actually the server's Spam folder which the Thunderbird client has recently started showing as the name Junk. If I open that folder it displays the email the server has classified as spam, and if I attempt to rename that Junk folder back to Spam it fails with a message that the Spam folder already exists. How do I rectify this situation?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:141.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/141.0

title: Trying to set up and embarqmail.net account
creator: mickelcsn
content: I m trying to set up as my third email in thunderbird an account which is mickel@embarqmail.com. It sets up using the manual settings following their server instruction fine. But it will not accept my password. I know it is correct because I can log in on their webmail site. What can I do? Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

title: Cannot download emails from centurylink.net
creator: grmoon51
content: Beginning on May 19,2025 my email will no longer download from centurylink to my Thunderbird program/account. I've tried talking to both centurylink and brightspeed that took over centurylink. They were completely clueless.

title: new Thunderbird 139.0.1 converting color jpg files to black and white
creator: nylason
content: How do I adjust settings to prevent Thunderbird 139.0.1 from converting color jpg files to black and white on my new Macbook Air. Old Macbook pro using Thunderbird ver 128.11.0 did not have this problem with the same email and attachment!
